    • Method Detail

      • project

        public static net.sf.javaml.core.Dataset project​(net.sf.javaml.core.Dataset data,
                                                 boolean[] mask)
        Generates a new dataset from the input data as a projection of some selected features according to mask. The length of mask should match the number of attributes in the dataset. Otherwise, the smaller value between the number of features in the dataset and the length of the mask will be used as the maximum number of selectable features.
        Parameters:
        data - Input dataset
        mask - Mask to select the features in the new dataset
        Returns:
        A new dataset containing only the features selected by the mask

      • project

        public static net.sf.javaml.core.Dataset project​(net.sf.javaml.core.Dataset data,
                                                 java.util.TreeSet<java.lang.Integer> selected)
        Generates a new dataset from the input data as a projection of some selected features according to some selected features.
        Parameters:
        data - Input dataset
        selected - Set of selected features
        Returns:
        A new dataset containing only the selected features

      • normalize

        public static void normalize​(net.sf.javaml.core.Dataset data)
        Normalizes all the attributes of a dataset in the range [0..1]
        Parameters:
        data - The dataset

      • normalize

        public static void normalize​(net.sf.javaml.core.Dataset training,
                             net.sf.javaml.core.Dataset test)
        Normalizes all the attributes of a couple of training and test datasets in the range [0..1]
        Parameters:
        training - The training dataset
        test - The test dataset

      • appendRandomAttributes

        public static void appendRandomAttributes​(net.sf.javaml.core.Dataset data,
                                          int nExtraAttrs)
        Appends some extra random attributes to each sample in the dataset.
        Parameters:
        data - The dataset
        nExtraAttrs - Number of random extra attributes to be appended

      • directLDA

        public static org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealMatrix directLDA​(net.sf.javaml.core.Dataset data,
                                                                   double SbTh)
        Performs a projection of a given dataset with the directLDA algorithm [1].

        [1] H. Yu, J. Yang. A direct LDA Algorithm for High-Dimensional Data - with application to Face Recognition. Pattern Recognition, 34(10):2067-2070, October 2001. https://doi.org/10.1016/S0031-3203(00)00162-X
        Parameters:
        data - Input dataset. As LDA is a supervised dimensionality reduction technique, this dataset must be labeled
        SbTh - Threshold to select the valid Sb eigenvalues.
        Returns:
        The projection matrix

      • directLDA

        public static org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealMatrix directLDA​(net.sf.javaml.core.Dataset data)
        Performs a projection of a given dataset with the directLDA algorithm. Uses a default value of 0.001 for the SbTh threshold.
        Parameters:
        data - Input dataset. As LDA is a supervised dimensionality reduction technique, this dataset must be labeled
        Returns:
        The projection matrix

      • project

        public static net.sf.javaml.core.Dataset project​(net.sf.javaml.core.Dataset data,
                                                 org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealMatrix proj)
        Generates a new dataset from the input data as a projection according to the given projection matrix.
        Parameters:
        data - Input dataset
        proj - Projection Matrix
        Returns:
        A new dataset containing only the selected features

      • split

        public static net.sf.javaml.core.Dataset split​(net.sf.javaml.core.Dataset original,
                                               double prop)
        Extracts a proportion of samples ramdomly from a original dataset and returns them as a new dataset. If data are labeled, this proportion is applied to each class.
        Parameters:
        original - Original data
        prop - Proportion of samples extracted from the original dataset. It must have a value greater the 0 and lower than 1.
        Returns:
        A new dataset containing the extracted samples
